resources.string:
How do you quit apps?
Tapping Back always means that you want to quit.
Tapping Home or Overview will put apps into background.

Brevent recognizes states of apps in this way, preventing apps in Brevent list from running in long time.

When you tap Back to quit apps, apps and bound services won\'t run anymore; tap Home or Overview, or just put apps into background, apps and bound services will keep running; swipe apps away from recents screen (also known as the Overview screen, recent task list, or recent apps), apps will be force-stopped. Whenever apps are wakened without activity, Brevent will force-stop them.\n\nApps in Brevent list can be set \"allow sync\" to receive notifications or execute jobs and syncs. Brevent won\'t brevent \"allow sync\" apps with sticky notifications nor foreground services, and Brevent won\'t force-stop \"allow sync\" apps with notifications or running in background.
What do you need to do? \nJust a simple command via ADB with your PC.
Brevent won\'t work if Android-powered device reboots. For Android O, Brevent won\'t work if you turn off \"USB Debugging\" or change USB options.
Brevent does not need Root or modify system files, there is no residue after uninstallation.

Brevent uses plenty of Android\'s hidden APIs. Some third-party ROMs may modify these APIs, so there would be some issues when using.\n\nDO NOT use Brevent on work devices, NOR BREVENT work apps, frequently used apps, important apps.
Enjoy Brevent, and if you find any issues, please feel free to feedback with logs.

The default Brevent method is \"Standby, then force-stop\". Standby (since Android 6.0, unsupported on some devices) apps can\'t access network, nor execute jobs and syncs.\n\nBrevent wouldn\'t force-stop safe cached apps by default. In addition, Brevent server brevent apps centrally and delays the processes by 3 to 60 seconds according to the event level.

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a command-line tool that lets a PC communicate with an Android device. It\'s part of platform-tools, you can download it from here: https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools.html (long-press to select and copy).

1. Uncompress platform-tools-latest-<platform>.zip

2. Navigate to platform-tools directory

3. (for Windows) Hold Shift key, then right-click, choose "Open command window here", then use ".\adb" to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

3. (for macOS) Navigate "Finder", "Applications", "Utilities", launch "Terminal", drag "adb" into the "Terminal", then use "adb" with full path to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

4. You need to ADB every time after you turn on your device, please avoid restarting or shutting down your device as much as possible

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure PC can recognize device (Reader "Guide - ADB")

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
Brevent server started successfully. Please tap app icons to choose then brevent them
Retrieving processes status, just a moment. . .
Waiting events, please expand then collapse notification to trigger events. . .
Starting Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Checking Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Feel free to feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
Update Brevent list when apps are installed or uninstalled(not supported on some ROMs)

Standby when you exit apps (tap \"Back\"), or background apps timed out; force-stop when reach standby time out or clear them from recents screen\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Standby when you exit apps (tap \"Back\"), or background apps timed out\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Force-stop when you exit apps (tap \"Back\"), or background apps timed out, or clear apps from recents screen\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent shows inactive time for background apps dynamically
Force-stop when apps have standby for %1$s\n\nBrevent doesn\'t show standby time
Brevent immediately, force-stop safe apps.\n\nSpecially for the OCD, check carefully
All apps have the same signature with framework\n\nBe careful when breventing core apps
Including system and core apps which cannot be launched\n\nBe careful when breventing system and core apps which cannot be launched
Optimize Brevent according notifications\n\nRecommends on. May cause device freeze or even reboot
Brevent immediately when apps return to home via non Home(such as Back)
Depends on \"Check notifications\". Won\'t be brevented while playing, won\'t be force-stopped while pausing with notification
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil via Play Store
Thanks for priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for paying %1$s Brefoil via Play Store, %2$s Brefoil via non Play Store
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil via Play Store, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for paying %s Brefoil, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for paying %1$s Brefoil via Play Store, %2$s Brefoil via non Play Store, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Check Brevent server every 15 minutes\n\nTurn on if Brevent stops unreasonably
Currently only simple read and write, still in progress
Brevent is only available for Owner.
Brevent is unavailable in App clone.
Brevent is only available without Xposed.
No permission to access Brevent server. Brevent does\'t support multi-user, parallel apps, or app clone.
No event log. Please do not disable \"USB debugging\", and modify the \"Logger buffer sizes\" in \"Developer options\" accordingly.
Brevent server is upgrading. Please try again later.
Cannot get logs. Please try again later.
Brevent can\'t access local network, please modify your settings of network, battery saver and force doze. Feedback with logs when necessary, or uninstall directly.
Since Android 8, Brevent server would stop working whenever \"USB Debugging\" turns off.\n\nDon\'t turn off \"USB debugging\", don\'t change USB options.
Brevent server has no sufficient permissions, some features are unavailable.
Brevent diagnosis is unsupported. Please make sure Brevent can run in background, then turn on again.
Invalid location for Brevent, please reinstall.
Thanks for paying total %1$s Brefoil via Alipay
Thanks for paying %1$s Brefoil via Alipay
Restarting Brevent Server, please try again later
Tap \"Records\" to confirm payment if you have paid
Can\'t confirm payment, please don\'t pay
%1$s\n(Please give a description for the logs.)
Tap here to feedback, and give a detailed description

If you have paid, please disable \"Xposed\", launch \"Alipay\", tap \"Records\", it should be recognized automatically.\n\nIf paid via non \"Alipay\", please send email with screenshots of payment details.
You have brevented %2$d apps in %1$d days. Please pay %3$s to make Brevent better.
